text: Improvement bill here welcome back to
the tamed course there's a lot of advice
out there when it comes to building
habits a lot of strategies that can and
do work but there is one that is
arguably the most powerful and that's
leveraging your social environment today
we'll go over three reasons why having
the right social environment is so
effective when it comes to building and
sticking to healthy habits with that
being said let's Jump Right In reason
number one is more rewards we all know
by now that having rewards is extremely
important for the formation of habits
without proper rewards The Habit never
becomes permanently ingrained and you'll
have a hard time getting yourself to
Crave it now one of the greatest types
of rewards out there are social rewards
we humans are extremely social creatures
so our brain has evolved to enjoy
interacting with others let's say you're
trying to build a habit of going to the
gym one of the best things you can do is
go with a friend or make some friends at
the gym imagine showing up for your
workout and seeing the regulars there
some of them wave at you and ask you how
you've been they to crack a couple of
jokes and you share a laugh and then you
get back to doing your next set these
interactions make you feel good during
your routine you're essentially getting
rewarded while you work out which
ultimately makes you crave doing it
again in the future now for those of you
wondering how do you even make friends
at the gym a simple way to do this is to
start a conversation with anyone by
asking for advice on something related
to working out or asking how much longer
they have for a set and then the next
time you see them just wave say hi smile
and ask them how they've been the same
types of benefits apply if you have a
friend who goes to the gym at the same
time you do moving on the second reason
leveraging your social environment is so
powerful is accountability we humans are
designed to easily be influenced by the
groups that we are in sometimes this is
a bad thing but oftentimes we can use it
to our advantage for example if you are
in a book club where everyone meets once
a week to discuss the next few chapters
of the book you risk looking bad if you
did not do your reading and this is
actually good because we all have an
innate desire to be accepted by the rest
of the group one of our greatest fears
is becoming an outcast this fear will
actually motivate and drive you to do
your reading it'll give you a reason to
override some of the excuses that you
might have right sometimes you might
think oh I don't have time to do this
week's reading but I also can't afford
to look like a bum in front of my
friends at the book club so I'll figure
something out this type of thinking will
help you stay more consistent when
building your habits and finally the
third reason why leveraging your social
environment is so powerful is because it
makes you think about the right things
our thoughts Drive our actions when we
constantly think about something our
chances of taking action in that
direction increases dramatically for
example if for some reason you've been
reading about pizza all day you'll
probably want to eat some pizza the same
thing applies to the habits in our life
when you are in a group where everyone
thinks about their health constantly
they will most likely bring it up in
group conversations and by simply being
in a group like this and reading their
messages you will also start thinking
about your Health more often and because
you think about it more often you will
start taking more action in that
direction and that's it this is why
having the right social environment is
arguably the most important thing when
it comes to building habits and a quick
shout out to P Judo an expert on
behavioral Psychology from another
Channel who gave me the idea for this
video you can check out one of his
videos in the description box below and
if you haven't watched the other videos
in the tame course you can find all of
those in the description box as well
besides that guys stay tuned
